text: After completing the upgrade, there are several important steps to ensure a smooth transition and proper system functionality: Restoring Custom JAR Files During the upgrade, the contents of $MZ_HOME/common/lib are cleared and replaced with updated JAR files. If you had previously added custom JAR files to your MediationZone installation, you will need to manually re-add them to the directory after the upgrade. Reinstalling the Legacy Desktop (If Needed) If you intend to continue using the Legacy Desktop, a fresh installation is required. Refer to Installation and Configuration of Legacy Desktop . Reviewing Post-Upgrade Notes Check the Post Upgrade section in the Release Notes for each upgraded version. This section may contain additional steps or important considerations specific to your upgrade path. Resume Workflow Execution Restart all ECs mzsh restart <ec name> Enable all Workflow Groups either through the Execution Manager in Desktop or by executing the following command: mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfgroupenable * Enable all Workflows either through the Execution Manager in Desktop or by executing the following command: mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfenable * Start the Workflow Group either through the Execution Manager in Desktop or by executing the following command, which will automatically start the workflows within it. mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfgroupstart * Or start the Workflows either through the Execution Manager in Desktop or by executing the following command: mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfstart *
title: Post Upgrade Steps - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
